paragraph.content: the names of owners of registered designs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars as to transactions, instruments or events affecting rights in or under registered designs and applications for registration; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such other matters as the Registrar may think fit.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (2), no notice of any trust, whether express, implied or constructive, shall be entered in the Register, and the Registrar shall not be affected by any such notice.
The Register need not be kept in documentary form.
Subject to subsection (4), the Register shall be prima facie evidence of anything required or authorized by this Ordinance or the rules to be registered.

A certificate purporting to be signed by the Registrar and certifying that any entry in the Register which he is authorized by this Ordinance or the rules to make has or has not been made, or that any other thing which he is so authorized to do has or has not been done, shall be prima facie evidence of the matters so certified.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following, that is to say—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in the Register or an extract from the Register which is supplied under section 69(1);

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any document kept in the Registry;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an extract from any such document;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any model or specification of a registered design; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any application for registration of a design,

subsection.continued: which purports to be a certified copy or a certified extract shall, subject to subsection (4), be admitted in evidence without further proof and without production of any original.

subsection.content: This section is without prejudice to section 22A or 22B or Part IV of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8) or any provision made by virtue of that section or Part. (Replaced 2 of 1999 s. 6)

subsection.def: In this section, certified copy (核證副本) and certified extract (核證摘錄) mean a copy and extract certified by the Registrar and sealed with the seal of the Registrar.

subsection.content: The court may, on the application of any person aggrieved, order the Register to be rectified by the making, or the variation or deletion, of any entry in it.
In proceedings under this section the court may determine any question which it may be necessary or expedient to decide in connection with the rectification of the Register.
Subject to the rules, the Registrar may correct any error in the Register.
A correction may be made under subsection (1) either upon a request in writing made by any person interested or on the Registrar’s own initiative.

Where the Registrar is requested to correct such an error by a person interested, any person may in accordance with the rules give the Registrar notice of opposition to the request and the Registrar shall determine the matter.
Subject to any rules, the public shall have a right to inspect the Register during the normal business hours of the Registry.
In relation to any portion of the Register kept otherwise than in documentary form the right of inspection conferred by subsection (1) is a right to inspect the material on the Register.

Any person who applies for a certified copy of an entry in the Register or a certified extract from the Register shall be entitled to obtain such a copy or extract on payment of a fee prescribed in relation to certified copies and extracts.
Any person who applies for an uncertified copy or extract shall be entitled to such a copy or extract on payment of a fee prescribed in relation to uncertified copies and extracts.
Applications under this section shall be made in such manner as may be prescribed.

In relation to any portion of the Register kept otherwise than in documentary form, the right to a copy or extract conferred by subsection (1) or (2) is a right to a copy or extract in a form in which it can be taken away and in which it is visible and legible.

After the registration of a design and upon the filing of a written request by any person in the prescribed manner, the Registrar shall give the person making the request such information, and permit him to inspect such documents, relating to the application for registration or the design concerned (including any representation, sample or specimen of the design) as may be specified in the request, subject, however, to any prescribed conditions.

Subject to this section, until notice of registration of a design is published under section 25, information or documents constituting or relating to the application shall not, without the consent of the owner or the applicant (as the case may be), be published or communicated to any person by the Registrar.
Subsection (2) shall not prevent the Registrar from publishing or communicating to others any prescribed information relating to an application for registration of a design.

Where a person is notified that an application for registration of a design has been made and that the applicant will, if the design is registered, bring proceedings against that person in the event of his doing an act specified in the notification, that person may make a request under subsection (1), notwithstanding that the design has not been registered, and that subsection shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Hours of business and business days

subsection.content: The Registrar may by notice published in the official journal give directions specifying the hours of business of the Registry for the purpose of the transaction of business under this Ordinance and the days that are business days for that purpose. (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 26)

Business done on any day after the specified hours of business, or on a day which is not a business day, shall be deemed to have been done on the next business day; and where the time for doing anything under this Ordinance expires on a day which is not a business day, that time shall be extended to the next business day.
Directions made under this section may make different provision for different classes of business.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Language of proceedings before Registrar
section.content: Except as otherwise provided in the rules, and notwithstanding section 5 of the Official Languages Ordinance (Cap. 5), the official language in which an application for registration of a design is filed shall be used as the language of proceedings in all proceedings before the Registrar under this Ordinance.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Exercise of Registrar’s discretionary powers
section.content: Without prejudice to any rule of law, the Registrar shall give any party to a proceeding before him an opportunity of being heard before exercising adversely to that party any discretion vested in the Registrar by this Ordinance or the rules.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Immunity of Registrar as regards official acts
section.leadIn: Neither the Registrar nor any public officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be taken to warrant the validity of the registration of any design registered under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall incur any liability by reason of, or in connection with, any examination required or authorized by this Ordinance, or any report or other proceedings consequent on any such examination or investigation.

subsection.content: Subject to this section, where under this Ordinance any act has to be done by or to any person in connection with a registered design or any procedure relating to a registered design or the registration of a design, the act may be done by or to an agent of such person duly authorized by that person orally or in writing.

A person duly authorized by another person under subsection (1) to act as his agent may (subject to any provision to the contrary in any agreement between the agent and that person) on giving notice to the Registrar and the other person, cease to act as agent for the other person.
The Registrar may refuse to recognize as agent in respect of any business under this Ordinance any person specified for the purpose in the rules.
The Registrar shall refuse to recognize as an agent a person who neither resides nor has a place of business in Hong Kong.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Correction of errors in filed documents

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the rules, the Registrar may upon request by any person interested correct any error of translation or transcription, any clerical error or any mistake made in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any application for registration of a design or document filed in connection with such an application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any representation of a design; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any document filed in connection with a registered design.

subsection.content: Any person may in accordance with the rules give the Registrar notice of opposition to the request and the Registrar shall determine the matter.

Where, either before or after the commencement* of this Ordinance, an application for registration of a design has been made and it appears to the Registrar that the design is one of a class notified to him by the Central People’s Government as relevant for defence purposes, the Registrar may give directions for prohibiting or restricting the publication of information with respect to the design, or the communication of such information to any person or class of persons specified in the directions. (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Rules may be made for securing that where such directions are given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the representation of the design; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any evidence filed in support of the applicant’s application for registration that the design is registrable,

subsection.continued: shall not be open to public inspection in the Registry during the continuance in force of the directions.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar gives such directions, he shall give notice of the application of the directions to the Central People’s Government, and thereupon the following provisions shall have effect— (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Central People’s Government may at any time after the design has been registered or, with the consent of the applicant, at any time before the design has been registered, inspect the representation of the design, or any such evidence as to its registrability;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if upon the consideration of the design at any time it appears to the Central People’s Government that the publication of the design would not, or would no longer, be prejudicial to the defence of the People’s Republic of China, notice may be given to the Registrar to that effect; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on the receipt of any such notice the Registrar shall revoke the directions and may, subject to such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit, extend the time for doing anything required or authorized to be done by or under this Ordinance in connection with the application for registration, whether or not that time has previously expired. (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

section.name: s78
section.heading: Forfeited articles
section.content: Nothing in this Ordinance affects the right of the Government or any person deriving title directly or indirectly from the Government to dispose of or use articles forfeited under the law relating to customs or excise.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance which contemplates or authorizes the making of rules (other than rules of court) with respect to any matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for prescribing anything authorized or required by a provision of this Ordinance to be prescribed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: generally for regulating the practice and procedure under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), rules made under this section may make provision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in connection with applications for registration of designs and other documents which may be filed with the Registrar—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: prescribing the form and contents of any such documents;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: requiring copies of any such documents to be filed with the Registrar; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: prescribing the manner of filing of any such documents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulating the procedure to be followed in connection with any proceeding or other matter before the Registrar and authorizing the rectification of irregularities of procedure;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: requiring fees to be paid in connection with any such proceeding or matter or in connection with the provision of any service by the Registry and providing for the remission of fees in the prescribed circumstances;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: empowering the Registrar, in such cases as may be specified in the rules, to require a party in any such proceeding to give security for costs, in relation to that proceeding or to proceedings on appeal, and providing for the consequences if security is not given;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: regulating the mode of giving evidence in any such proceeding and empowering the Registrar to compel the attendance of witnesses and the discovery of and production of documents;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: prescribing time limits for doing anything required to be done in connection with any such proceeding by this Ordinance or the rules and providing for the alteration of any period of time specified in this Ordinance or the rules;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 72, requiring and regulating the translation of documents in connection with a registered design or an application for registration of a design into the language of the proceedings or into one or both of the official languages and the filing and verification of any such translations; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: providing for the publication and sale of documents by the Registry and of information about such documents.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section may make different provision for different cases.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorizing the rectification of irregularities of procedure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the alteration of any period of time,

subsection.continued: may authorize the extension or further extension of any period of time notwithstanding that the period has already expired.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section prescribing fees (including any penalty fee required by rules made under section 82(2)(b)) shall not be made except with the consent of the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: Any rules made under subsection (2)(c) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe fees fixed at; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for fees to be fixed at,

subsection.continued: levels that provide for the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government or other authority in the exercise of any or all functions under this Ordinance, and shall not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in the exercise of any particular function.

subsection.content: Rules may be made under this section providing for arrangements to be made by the Registrar for the publication of reports of decisions or orders made by the Registrar under this Ordinance or decisions or orders relating to designs made by any court or body (whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere).

section.name: s80
section.heading: Rules relating to applications for registration

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 79, the Registrar may, for the purposes of section 12, make rules providing that an application for registration of a design shall or may contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement describing the representation of the design;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement describing the features of the design which the applicant considers to be new;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the classification of the articles to which the design is intended to be applied, according to any class or sub-class specified by the rules; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a specimen or sample of the article to which the design reproduced in the representation is applied.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may provide for the manner in which the following matters shall or may be contained in an application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any claim that section 9, 10 or 11 applies in relation to the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any claim to the priority of an earlier application and supporting priority documents in accordance with section 16.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Rules relating to registration of designs, etc.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to any other provision of this Ordinance, the Registrar shall make rules requiring the registration of designs and of transactions, instruments or events affecting rights in or under registered designs and applications for registration of designs.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the filing of any prescribed documents or description of documents in connection with any matter which is required to be registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the correction of errors in the Register and in any documents filed in connection with applications for registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the publication and advertisement of anything done under this Ordinance in relation to the Register.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section may provide for notification to the Registrar of any matter affecting rights in an application for registration of a design.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Rules relating to language of proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 79, the Registrar may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requiring, in respect of any document filed or to be filed in proceedings under this Ordinance, the filing of a translation of the document into the language of the proceedings or into one or both of the official languages;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the use by any person in oral proceedings before the Registrar of a language other than the language of the proceedings;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in respect of documents to be used for the purpose of evidence in proceedings before the Registrar and which are in a language other than the language of the proceedings, providing for the filing of the document in that other language and the filing of a translation of the document into the language of the proceedings or into one of the official languages; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in respect of information provided or to be provided to the Registrar and which is to be entered in the Register, requiring the provision of that information in both official languages.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under subsection (1)(a) or (d)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify periods within which translations of documents into the language of the proceedings or into the official languages are to be filed or within which information in the official languages is to be provided; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may provide for extensions, upon application by a party to the proceedings, of such periods, and may require that applications for such extension shall be subject to the payment of a prescribed penalty fee.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations— (Amended 22 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: adding to the Schedule the name of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any country which has acceded to the Paris Convention;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any territory or area subject to the authority or under the suzerainty of any country, or administered by any country, on behalf of which such country has acceded to the Paris Convention; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any country, territory or area which has acceded to the World Trade Organization Agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: deleting from the Schedule the name of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any country which has denounced the Paris Convention;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any territory or area on behalf of which the Paris Convention has been denounced; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any country, territory or area which has denounced the World Trade Organization Agreement; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise amending the Schedule.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Registrar may specify forms to be used

subsection.content: The Registrar may require the use of such forms as he may, by notice published in the official journal, specify in connection with the registration of a design or any other proceeding before him under this Ordinance. (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 26)
A notice under subsection (1) may contain any direction of the Registrar with respect to the use of a form specified in the notice.

A notice published under subsection (1) shall not be regarded as subsidiary legislation for the purpose of section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1). (Added 2 of 2001 s. 24)

section.name: s84A
section.heading: Power to specify official journal, etc.

subsection.content: The Registrar may from time to time, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a publication to be the official journal of record for the purposes of this Ordinance, with effect as of the date specified in the notice.

Where a publication is specified under subsection (1), every notice, request, document or other matter required by this Ordinance or the rules to be published in the official journal shall, from the effective date specified in the notice, be published in the publication so specified, and any reference in this Ordinance or the rules to the official journal shall be construed accordingly.

The Registrar may publish or cause to be published a journal in which there may be published such documents and information relating to a registered design or an application for registration as the Registrar thinks fit.
For the avoidance of doubt, the Registrar may specify the Gazette or the journal referred to in subsection (3) to be the official journal of record.
A publication specified under subsection (1) and the journal referred to in subsection (3) need not be in a documentary form.
A notice published under subsection (1) shall not be regarded as subsidiary legislation for the purpose of section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s85
section.heading: Falsification of Register, etc.
section.leadIn: Any person who makes or causes to be made a false entry in the Register, or a writing falsely purporting to be a copy or reproduction of an entry in the Register, or produces or tenders or causes to be produced or tendered in evidence any such writing, knowing or having reason to believe the entry or writing to be false, commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s86
section.heading: False representation that design is registered

subsection.content: Subject to this section, any person who falsely represents that a design applied to any article disposed of by him for value is registered in respect of that article commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a person who for value disposes of an article having stamped, engraved or impressed on it or otherwise applied to it the word “registered” or “註冊” or anything expressing or implying that a design applied to the article is registered in respect of that article, shall be taken to represent that the design applied to the article is registered in respect of the article.
In proceedings for an offence under this section it shall be a defence for the accused to prove that he used due diligence to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Misuse of title “Designs Registry”
section.content: Any person who uses on his place of business, or on any document issued by him, or otherwise, the words “Designs Registry” or “外觀設計註冊處” or any other words suggesting that his place of business is, or is officially connected with, the Registry, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Contravention of directions given under section 77
section.leadIn: Any person who contravenes a direction given by the Registrar under section 77 commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: Where an offence under this Ordinance committed by a body corporate is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, or a person who was purporting to act in any such capacity, he as well as the body corporate, is guilty of the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply for the purposes of proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance alleged to have been committed by a body corporate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any rules of court relating to the service of documents; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 19A (plea by a corporation before a magistrate) and section 87 (procedure on charge of indictable offence against corporation) of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).

subsection.content: Where the affairs of a body corporate are managed by its members, subsection (1) shall apply in relation to the acts and defaults of a member in connection with his functions of management as if he were a director of the body corporate.

Where an offence under this Ordinance committed by a partner in a partnership is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any other partner of the partnership, that other partner shall be guilty of the offence and liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Transitional Provisions, Consequential Amendments and Repeal

subsection.def: In this section and sections 91 to 93, the Registered Designs Act 1949 (《1949年註冊外觀設計法令》) means the Registered Designs Act 1949 (1949 c. 88 U.K.), as amended and as applied to Hong Kong by the United Kingdom Designs (Protection) Ordinance (Cap. 44).

subsection.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, any word or expression used in sections 91 to 93 and defined in the Registered Designs Act 1949 has the same meaning as in that Act.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Designs deemed registered under this Ordinance

subsection.content: Any design registered under the Registered Designs Act 1949 before the date of commencement* of this Ordinance the right in which is subsisting or is treated as subsisting on that date shall be deemed to be registered under this Ordinance in respect of the articles for which it is registered under that Act.

Any design registered under the Registered Designs Act 1949 on or after the date of commencement of this Ordinance the application for which was pending on the date immediately preceding the date of commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to be registered under this Ordinance in respect of the articles for which it is registered under that Act.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance, the initial period of registration of a design deemed by subsection (1) to be registered under this Ordinance shall consist of the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of commencement of this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the right in the design expires under the Registered Designs Act 1949; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the right in the design would expire under that Act if the period for which the right is subsisting on the date of commencement of this Ordinance could not be extended in accordance with section 8(2) of that Act.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance, the initial period of registration of a design deemed by subsection (2) to be registered under this Ordinance shall consist of the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of registration of the design under the Registered Designs Act 1949; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the right in the design expires under the Registered Designs Act 1949; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the right in the design would expire under that Act if the period for which the right subsists under section 8(1) of that Act could not be extended in accordance with section 8(2) of that Act.

subsection.content: The period of registration of a design deemed by section 91 to be registered under this Ordinance may be extended for additional periods of 5 years each but the total period of registration under this Ordinance and the Registered Designs Act 1949 may not exceed 25 years and 6 months in the aggregate.

If the registered proprietor of the design desires to renew the period of registration for a further period of 5 years after the initial period of registration referred to in section 91(3) or (4) expires, he shall submit an application to the Registrar in accordance with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The application referred to in subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: be submitted before the later of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date that is 6 months prior to the expiration of the initial period of registration under this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
i
subparagraph.content: a representation of the design as registered under the Registered Designs Act 1949;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a certificate confirming registration of the design issued by the Registrar of the United Kingdom Designs Registry;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a certified copy of an entry in, or a certified extract from, the United Kingdom Designs Registry, stating the full name of the proprietor of the design immediately preceding the application; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: such other information, documents or matter as may be required by the rules; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed renewal fee.

subsection.content: Section 28(3), (4) and (5) applies to any further renewal of the period of registration of a design deemed by section 91 to be registered under this Ordinance.

The registered proprietor of a design deemed by section 91 to be registered under this Ordinance shall not be entitled to recover any damages in respect of any infringement of the design from any defendant who proves that at the date of the infringement he was not aware, nor had any reasonable means of making himself aware, of the existence of the registration of the design under the Registered Designs Act 1949.
Nothing in subsection (1) shall affect any proceedings for an injunction.

The court shall have the power, upon the application of any person who alleges that his interests have been prejudicially affected by this section, to declare that exclusive privileges and rights in a design have not been acquired in Hong Kong under section 91 upon any of the grounds upon which the United Kingdom registration might have been cancelled under the Registered Designs Act 1949; such grounds shall be deemed to include the publication of the design in Hong Kong prior to the date of registration of the design under that Act.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings for infringement of a design deemed by section 91 to be registered under this Ordinance, the court shall apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the law applicable in Hong Kong in relation to infringements occurring before the date of commencement* of this Ordinance as if the United Kingdom Designs (Protection) Ordinance (Cap. 44) had not been repealed; and (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 150)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the law of Hong Kong in relation to infringements occurring on or after the date of commencement of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The United Kingdom Designs (Protection) Ordinance (Cap. 44) is repealed.

subsection.leadIn: Any thing done under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the United Kingdom Designs (Protection) Ordinance (Cap. 44); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registered Designs Act 1949 (1949 c. 88 U.K.), as amended and as applied to Hong Kong by the United Kingdom Designs (Protection) Ordinance (Cap. 44),

subsection.continued: shall, if in force on the commencement* of this Ordinance, and so far as it could have been done under this Ordinance, continue in force and have effect as if done under the corresponding provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A reference in any document to the United Kingdom Designs (Protection) Ordinance (Cap. 44) shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as a reference to this Ordinance.
